comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: I opened Kuda just now and it is not working. It popped up an update and I updated it but still not working. This is usual with Kuda and it is always disappointing when I have not experienced anything like that on Opay. I will advice you to use Opay more often. You can also have both in case if one is not working, the other will be working. Palmpay is also good.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: I make use of Kuda too, and I noticed the warning earlier today, but lucky for me, that's not the only active bank that I make use of. Although their card fiction is still working, I used the card to fund my Opay account since the money I have there was just below #100,000. I had to move the balance down to my Opay account, and from my Opay, I was able to slip all the funds down to my monipoint and other bank apps I have on my phone.Â If you have a card from Kuda Bank and it's still active, I will advise you to use the card to make an online deposit into your Opay account. Using the card fund option, a code will be sent to your line. When you register your Kuda account, you can use the code to authorise the transaction. At the moment, it's only the card payment that's going through, so if you need funds, you should take advantage of that until they are done with their upgrade.

comments.author: Justbillywitt
comments.body: You don't have to panic unnecessarily, if you have been using the kuda bank for long now you should have understand how they operates. Next time when something like this happens before you panic, go to the company official social media handle on X (formerly known as Twitter) or Facebook and see the reason why such a thing is happening. At all points companies always drop update on their social media handles.
